definition: to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)
variant of 肏[cao4]
old variant of 操[cao1]
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)
urgent/pressing/rapid/hurried/worried/to make (sb) anxious

sentences.english: Now, let's think this over. Let's not go off at half-cocked .
sentences.chinese: 让我们仔细考虑一下这件事吧，不可操之过急。

sentences.english: First, must correct the manner, everything cannot act with undue haste, is weaned is also same.
sentences.chinese: 首先，要端正态度，凡事不能操之过急，断奶也一样。

sentences.english: I think he is being too hasty.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他有些操之过急。

sentences.english: Scientists have determined it's not advisable to hurry marriage.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们建议，结婚也不可以操之过急。

sentences.english: Attempts to blame England's recent riots on youth unemployment were overhasty.
sentences.chinese: 对最近英国无业青年暴乱的谴责似乎操之过急了。

sentences.english: A commander mustn't get too anxious for the sake of some partial advantage.
sentences.chinese: 一个指挥员不要因为局部利益操之过急。

sentences.english: But cannot act too hastily, and should perserve.
sentences.chinese: 但不可操之过急，而应持之以恒。

sentences.english: However, patience should be needed during its operation in case new hidden ganger would be left.
sentences.chinese: 但对待该问题也不能操之过急，以免留下新的隐患。

definition: anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/don't try to run before you can walk
in sequence, step by step (idiom); to make steady progress incrementally
take your time/take it easy
to advance prematurely
anxious/impatient
to take one's time making a decision (idiom)/to consider at length
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/also written 欲速則不達|欲速则不达
to save a little only to lose a lot (idiom)
lit. to want to get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. to try to achieve one's goal in the shortest time possible/to be impatient for success
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 ge5 pang4 zi5

definition: to spoil things through excessive enthusiasm (idiom)
seeking instant benefit (idiom); shortsighted vision, looking only for fast return
too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
eager to/in a hurry to
blind/blindly/ignorant/lacking understanding
